alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; St. Landry; Upper St. Martin (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 11:01AM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lafayette, northwestern St. Martin and St. Landry Parishes through 1130 AM CDT... At 1101 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Krotz Springs, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Opelousas, Krotz Springs, Leonville, Arnaudville, Melville, Palmetto, Sunset, Port Barre, Washington, Grand Coteau, Cecilia, Atchafalaya National Wildlife Refuge and Lebeau. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 9 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Lafayette; St. Landry; Upper St. Martin
